page.title: 02Audley Brow and Styche Farm
page.content: Audley Brow is a dairy farm situated in 220 acres of land which is all down to grass.The farmer has 377 head of cattle which includes young stock.The farmer thinks the farm gets its name from Lord Audley who was supposed to have camped on the hill and fought a battle there.The farmhouse is about 150 years old. Styche Farm is situated in 147 acres of land which is mostly grass but some corn.The farmer has cows and horses. There are 3.5 acres of dried up fish pond and 4 acres of woodland which is called The Fox Cover.On half of the boundary there is a river called The Duckow.Parts of the farmhouse are 400 years old. Both farms were originally part of the Styche Estate owned by the Clive family.
